thread.title: Game preview: MSU vs. Texas A
thread.title_full: Game preview: MSU vs. Texas A

title: Game preview: MSU vs. Texas A
text:
Game preview: MSU vs. Texas A&M Michael Bonner, The Clarion-Ledger 6:01 a.m. CDT October 2, 2015 Buy Photo Mississippi State quarterback Dak Prescott completed 20 of 26 passes for two touchdowns while running for 77 yards and three touchdowns against Texas A&M last season. (Photo: Keith Warren/For The Clarion-Ledger) Buy Photo 1 CONNECT TWEET LINKEDIN COMMENT EMAIL MORE 
Breaking down Saturday's game: 
THE SETUP 
Mississippi State has never beaten Texas A&M in consecutive seasons. MSU hasn’t won at College Station, Texas since 1913. 
Last year, the Bulldogs upended the Aggies at Davis Wade Stadium, as part of a two-game sweep against top 10 opponents. The back-to-back wins against Auburn and Texas A&M, jolted Mississippi State to No. 1 in the country. 
This year, No. 21 MSU enters the matchup with No. 14 Texas A&M already with one SEC loss. The Aggies are undefeated with wins over Arizona State and Arkansas. 
Two losses in the first five games of the season would all but end the Bulldogs’ chances at an SEC West crown. A win at Kyle Field, would set up MSU nicely down the stretch. 
3 THINGS WE’RE TALKING ABOUT 
Dak Attack 
Dak Prescott has gained 673 total yards against Texas A&M in his career. Last year, the quarterback completed 20 of 26 passes for two touchdowns while running for 77 yards and three touchdowns. He also caught an 11-yard pass. 
Prescott didn’t play in the fourth quarter of his trip to Kyle Field in 2013 because of an elbow injury. He still totaled 303 yards and two touchdowns. 
The fifth-year senior finished with 284 yards last week against Auburn to eclipse 1,000 total yards against Auburn in his career. 
The time is now 
Mississippi State has the fewest carries in the Southeastern Conference. Only Washington State has run the ball less than MSU within the Power 5 conferences. 
The Bulldogs rank 12th in the league in yards per game, but average 5 yards per carry, which is the fifth-best in the SEC. The matchup with the Aggies provides an opportunity to pad those rushing stats. Texas A&M allows the second-most rushing yards of any SEC team. Ball State and Arkansas each ran for more than 230 yards. 
Finishing the fourth 
Mississippi State is the only SEC West team to not have allowed a touchdown in the fourth quarter this season. The Bulldog have allowed six points in four fourth quarters this season. Only Missouri has allowed less with three points. 
Overall, MSU is outscoring its opponents 34-6 in the fourth quarter. GAME-DAY DATA 
Where: Kyle Field, College Station, Texas 
Television: SEC Network 
Radio: 105.9 FM/105.1 FM XM 190; Sirius 83 
Last meeting: 48-31, MSU, 2014 
All-time series: Series tied 4-4 KEEP AN EYE ON 
Christian Kirk, WR: The freshman leads the Southeastern Conference averaging 110.5 yards per game. He also has four touchdowns and averages 18.4 yards per catch. UNIT THAT COULD GIVE MSU FITS 
Texas A&M quarterbacks: The Aggies have averaged 381 yards passing the last three seasons against the Bulldogs. Even in two games at Houston, Kevin Sumlin’s offenses averaged 395 yards per game against MSU. 1 CONNECT TWEET LINKEDIN COMMENT EMAIL MORE Read or Share this story: http://on.thec-l.com/1RjWbiz TOP VIDEOS
